comment: No structure or organization, felt like he came up with plans on the fly. Syllabus dates were never right, assignments were not accurate as listed. He is intelligent and passionate; willing to work with you if grade was unfavorable. If you are okay with little structure, you'll do fine! If you need structure/have GPA anxiety, should reconsider.

Like other reviews, this professor doesn't teach in a traditional way. While he is very passionate about history, his grading rubric is confusing for every assignment. My biggest issue is that 25% of your overall grade will be on maintaining notes... I don't take notes...
Overall, just attend class and participate and you'll get an A.

Seneca is such a cool guy, empathetic and funny. Group tests, debates and class games. Requires you to go to school events and drive to historical places for projects. You have to be paying attention and engaged in class. Definitely not a normal history class. A little too much work for a pre-rec though especially taking other sciences for my major
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I genuinely can't understand why his score is where it is. Before picking this class, I was anxious due to the reviews but as long as you show up you should pass. Class is simple and he is very passionate about history. Our class met Harriet Tubman great great grand niece and as an assignment, we toured historical places in GA. Awesome professor :)

When registering for a history class, I wasn't expecting for it to also be a law class, with every discussion post including different jury positions. I personally found it very uninteresting and time consuming. Also, he's a very tough grader and doesn't give feedback on how you can improve. LOTS of reading and videos. Good luck!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor and very fun and interesting classes. You can tell he is very passionate about what he teaches and is different from most history classes which are boring, he genuinely tries to make them fun or interesting. Ask lots of questions if you need clarification, he is very receptive. Make sure to take notes and do the work.

Dr. Vaught's class was unlike any course I've ever taken. If you are not prepared to try something different, don't take his class. However, his method for this online course actually taught me more than I expected. He doesn't give traditional lectures, but his teaching was much more engaging, in my opinion. No quizzes or exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: If you are really organized and like knowing what your grade is, he is not the professor for you. He expects 2 pages of notes from him talking, and 2 pages from the textbook. No tests just notebook checks. Midterm is final grade unless you turn in all the notebooks he didn't feel like grading so goodluck.

he prefers to go in-depth about different moments in history that aren't really talked about, however, these lectures/rants get long, boring, and confusing. oftentimes you don't know what he is talking about or how the topic is relevant. be prepared to read a lot of textbooks excerpts as well as critically think to complete your homework.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: I had decided to take this class as I am very interested in History, especially recent History. I went into this class excited but as I spent more time on this class, I ended up uninterested and all around confused. He does not give very clear instructions on his assignments nor does he provide any helpful feedback on those assignments.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Has been disrespectful regarding emails to students, and no matter how many times you email him, he will never fully answer your question. Weird grader, took points off for following the outline he provided us with and told us to use. Will not give you an A on a debate and will nitpick everything. Assignments are published late and is never clear.
He was kinda all over the place with assignments and grading but he's cool and understanding. you'll view life different with this class.

This class was unlike anything I have done before. There are no tests or quizzes, but there are weekly discussion debates that have to be lengthy. There are also a few papers and a midterm that is 3 parts. Not the worst class if you're good at writing, but otherwise pretty difficult.

There are no test, but a lot of work. There are weekly debates where and he grades pretty harshly. There are 3 case studies and a long midterm that requires you to read a whole book. The only great thing I can say is he has extra credits assignments. He doesn't really respond to student's email and instructions can be unclear.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I get all A's most semesters, so my review is not from a lack of effort. Barely any grading guidelines, and they are confusing. He does not respond to student emails, and does not return grades in a reasonable time. The layout and assignments make no sense, and the due dates in D2L are not correct. If you like your GPA like I do, AVOID AVOID AVOID
Easy just go to class do notebook for the grade (he grades every Friday) and do the class work.

Here is a prof who LOVES to teach. He effuses enthusiasm for history. He also has a terrific sense of humor and is a fascinating lecturer. Yes, he will make you work, but via some of the most creative and thought-challenging assignments in your college career. Be advised, the online syllabus changes frequently. Check it weekly!

Interesting class. Understand the syllabus his lessons are unlike any I've ever had. This frustrated me at first because I did not understand it. Midterm is graded hard, however, he corrects in detail and your final (option to edit) takes the place of both grades. Material to read/watch was thought-provoking. Discussions also intergraded and "fun."

When I signed up for this course I thought it was going to be extremely challenging from these responses on this website, however I managed to get an A. There are discussion posts weekly but no formal quizzes or tests. He is a fairly good grader. There is a midterm and final that are graded harder. This class was confusing with directions sometimes
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I took this as a summer class and throughout the semester there were assignmently reasonably spaced out but the last 2 weeks included a midterm 4 discussion posts and a final - he gives minimal information about what he actually wants for assignments and when grading the feedback he gives is "to look at other students with higher grades" ://

I took this professor in an online summer course. It is very work heavy, but there are no traditional lectures or tests. I learned a LOT this semester. I thought I knew everything about history, but I clearly didnt. His class is a lot of work, but I highly recommend.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I took his class on Semester at Sea and I loved Dr. V. He knows a lot about the topics he is teaching. His teaching style is a bit messy so if you really like to organize classes you will not enjoy it that much. A lot of discussions.

Dr. Vaught has a great personality and his summer class was easy. He says you'll need certain books for the class but you definitely could get an A without them. The class was all discussion and lecture-based with a few movie clips mixed in. We didn't have any tests or quizzes. He graded our notes and there was one major project at the end.

In the beginning, I was worried because I was failing the first few quizzes (which are always online). But its best to always pay attention in class, AND at least skim through the readings he gives because both are included in the quizzes. In the end, he dropped most of our lowest quiz grades and discussion post! And he always made class fun
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: I have taken Dr. Vaught's classes on multiple occasions. He is very passionate about the African diaspora, if that's not your thing or you want an easy A, this is not for you.
Was not a fan on this class or his teaching style.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class has no structure. AT ALL. The students basically have to keep him on track & he grades on how he feels that day. Gave one girl a D but when she questioned him why, he said "Oh my bad" & changed it to a 100%? How does that even happen? We also had a "group" summer project which was a summer book. Wouldn't recommend. Insanity.

His online class is a mess. The syllabus is all wacky and it took the whole class about a week to decipher it and actually figure out the due dates and where things need to be posted. You're also going to be reading A LOT so get ready to talk about social issues through history
Took him for a Hiphop class and black feminist combo class and it was honestly the best course to date i have taken at KSU and im a senior about to graduate.

Dr. Vaught is a great Professor. One of the greatest at Kennesaw. If you need help with something he stays after class to talk and meets with you during his office hours. Includes students in lectures. A lot of group activities, but they are fun. Loved his class. TAKE Dr V, but be prepared to work
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: I loved Dr. Vaught's personality, but I was not a fan of his his teaching style. Lots of long in class lectures, lots of reading from required books to be able to do weekly discussion posts, and no clarity on assignments, such as the stressful year long assignment worth a large portion of your grade. Also, I walked away not really learning much.

He has a really nice personality and is funny. His lectures were sometimes confusing. We had a yearlong project that stressed everyone out completely. That being said, I still managed to get an A both on the project and in the class.

No tests, only discussion posts. Semester long project that leaves most confused. Didn't learn anything. Discussion in class. Tends to be more about African Americans than US History since 1877. Rubrics also confusing/grading is not clear. Books required but use them rarely. Would not take this class again.

Dr. V has a great personality but he is an awful teacher. This class requires a lot of reading. Class is based on modules and reading is essential to passing. The main problem is that he is vague with his direction. His class causes unnecessary stress.

Dr. V makes history so much harder than it should be. There are 3 mandatory books. He grades by discussion posts only and they are NOT easy. His directions are extremely vague... one time he gave us a group project with no instructions. This class will give you unnecessary stress. He is an awesome person, but an awful teacher. (not same for online)
Make sure you listen to his lectures!! Most of the test questions come from the lectures. Hard effort is not required BUT  you must complete all assignments to get an A.
I took him for an online African American Studies class. He's a great teacher. I would recommend to anybody.

Dr. Vaught is one of the most knowledgeable History professors I have ever had the pleasure of being instructed by. For any potential students, I have to warn you, his class is NO joke. Be ready to LISTEN and take notes when he lectures (in class or online)

He is one of the best professors I have had at KSU and has a real passion for teaching.  He provides plenty of feedback on graded work and grades fairly.  There are weekly discussions and a quiz. The final was a 25 question multiple choice exam and a 10 page thesis on the book that was reviewed for the midterm.

DO NOT TAKE HIM. Tons of work, quiz and test worded in a very confusing way. Not clear, too much work for a general ed requirement. Quiz and discussion every week, tons of reading. Read an extra book and write about it for midterm and final (10 pages).

Dr. Vaught is wonderful - kind, intelligent, engaging, and passionate about his job. Being a conservative, I didn't always agree with his black-centric philosophy, but he never went about his opinions in an offensive way. I can't imagine anyone disliking him.

There's a TON of work for this class. A lot of reading (textbook and your own individual book for midterm and final)but Dr. Vaught makes this class really enjoyable. I LOVED his teaching style. Memorization of facts is not required, only your interpretations of documents. If you actually want to learn something about history, TAKE HIM!

VERY SCARY.  Good information, but I had NO CLUE I had to write a term paper along with ALL the other readings.  Then to top it off, there is a comprehensive FINAL at the end.  Too much work for a SUMMER ONLINE CLASS.  10 weeks weeks is not enough! It has to be better in the classroom.
He is a good teacher and is always there to help you. He makes learning fun and is very engaging.

Dr. Vaught is one of the best professors I have ever had! He has a very unique way of teaching and keeps it interesting. He makes his lectures fun and educative! He is a fair grader. Take him if you get a chance, you won't regret it!

With his online class, he expects an absolute amazing amount of work. No fewer than 100 pages are assigned every week, for a 10 question quiz. Its completely disproportionate.He only gives the lecture after the quiz has been taken. The lecture is good, but ineffectual since it doesn't help you prepare for the quiz.

NO WORDS CAN DESCRIBE DR. VAUGHT! This was the best class I have taken in my 4yrs of college! Class is hard, but your in college grow up. Learned and laughed so much this semester. Love his teaching style, and the fact that he teaches outside normal textbook facts. AMAZING! p.s. notice all the neg reviews are lower level lazy slackers!

Do not take this class if you are not prepared to work. He is very clear about how much work he requires from the very first day. Make no mistake you will have to put more into this class than some of your major classes. But he is an excellent teacher.

DO NOT TAKE. His final exam assessment is extremely difficult, and he incredibly harsh on grading the final exam project, despite his lack of directions. I was trying to be nice when I rated him 11/1/11, but in all honesty I see why people don't like him.  He does not respond promptly to questions, and is quite difficult when you ask him anything.

He is an amazing teacher. I absolutely hate history but this was my favorite class most of the semester. Lots of reading and quizzes online each week. Final project that you work on most of the semester is difficult. Not an easy class, but manageable if you work at it. I would definitely recommend him.

I love this class and Dr.V hope to take him again! Really dont know what up with the bad reviews yes his class is hard but if you put in the work you will learn something he can get off topic but he always gets the information you need to you. very fun teacher intersting class. if you can take Dr. V you wont regreat it.

The previous remarks were not representative of Dr. Vaught. He is very passionate about history. He teaches info other teachers dont teach. Quizzes each week (not easy, but online, open for 24 hrs before class). Interesting videos in class, posts PPTs online. You should still go to classes. He is a good teacher but dont expect an easy A or B.
Agree with the earlier comment regarding talked about jazz for two classes talked about WWI and WWII for 2 minutes, run away!!!!from this guy

Dr. V is passionate about African American History. His excitement for the material gets you interested even if you're not crazy about studying history. We barely used the textbook, but the lecture was so good, notes aren't needed. The tests are multiple choice and fairly easy. Take him! You might just learn something!
I thought history was facts? Not according to this teacher, he uses Paradox's you know its a bad history class when you talk more about Jazz music than WWI or WWII put togther!!!! Do not take him
I did not like his style of teaching. You have to do a group project plus a paper, which is a huge part of your grade. One final and one midterm, I would not reccomend him.

The class is not very hard if you keep up with homework and take good notes. He is one of those good professors that can be funny while still teaching. Attendance is not mandatory but a lot of info is covered every class so I wouldn't recommend it. Extremely funny professor and interesting class! Take his class!
